intro: Epicranthes decarhopalon, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Despite its ornamental appeal, it contains toxic alkaloids and should be handled with care.
